data.name: advancedText
data.value:
The program can theoretically be used with some small mods (if the mod does not violate the logic of the original game files).
To work with the mod, you need in the folder./rndata/gamedata/config in the gameplay, misc, weathers, and weapons directories, replace the necessary files with modified ones (if necessary, make a backup copy of the original files). After that, you should adjust the lists according to the content of the mod.
If there are additional models and NPC voice acting in the modification, you just need to write down the paths to them in the lists by analogy with how the original models / voice acting are written. The files themselves don't need to be copied anywhere.
The options on this tab are highly likely to not work with other mods. When activating these parameters, pre-edited game files are copied, which, if replaced, may break the mod.

data.name: ammoListTitle
data.value: Cartridges and its num. in a pack

data.name: artefactsDataError
data.value: The path for saving artifacts is not specified. An "updateData" call is required

data.name: dialogsDataError

data.name: dialogsDescription
data.value:
Changing the dialogues completely breaks the plot and most of the quests, so it is recommended to enable unlocking Sidorovich's door from the start of the game and give the main character a knife (the "Advanced" tab).
By default, the lists of broken infos/actions contain infos/actions that cause the game to crash or the interface to freeze. However, they can record any other infos/actions that you want to exclude from generation.
XML tags for infos are has_info, dont_has_info, and give_info. The XML tag for actions is action.
If you want to mix the dialogs of a mod, then the dialog files should be placed in the rndata/gameplay_dialogs folder. At the same time, make sure that each file has only one XML tag in its root.

data.name: epilepsy
data.value: It is not recommended to turn it on if you have ever had epileptic seizures

data.name: freedomAgression
data.value: Disable the hostility of the Freedom base if there are NPCs hostile to the player on it

data.name: gScriptFix
data.value: Fix (possible, but not all) crashes during a long game at late locations

data.name: itemReplaceProbInput
data.value: The probability of generating for each consumables stat

data.name: ItemsGuide
data.value:
All lists on this tab are used to add items to caches and to edit the assortment of merchants.
Armor and artifact stats are generated in the files "outfit.ltx" and "artefacts.ltx" (directory ./rndata/gamedata/config/misc) and does not depend on these lists
Rules for generating items in caches. Number of items from 1 to 7 (Each item is selected randomly and can be repeated) Probability of generating an item by type: Armor - 5%, 1 pc. Weapons - 10%, 1 pc. Artifact - 5%, 1-2 pcs. Consumables - 50%, 1-8 pcs. Cartridges - 25%, 1-6 packs Other - 5%, 1-2 pcs.

data.name: knifeAtStart
data.value: Give the player a knife at the beginning of the game

data.name: loadError
data.value: The following files could not be loaded:

data.name: mainFormName
data.value: Simple randomizer for "S.T.A.L.K.E.R.: Shadow of Chernobyl"

data.name: maxThreads
data.value: Maximum number of threads to process

data.name: moreGulag
data.value: Expand the joining of NPCs to camps (breaks some scripts. It can lead to crashes when playing for a long time, especially on version 1.0006)

data.name: moreRespawn
data.value: Increase the respawn rate of NPCs (may lead to crashes during a long game, especially on version 1.0006)

data.name: npcDataError
data.value: Data for the generation of NPCs were not received. An "updateData" call is required

data.name: npcGuide
data.value:
Manipulations with NPCs (especially when changing groupings) can increase the probability of a crash Also, when NPC generation is enabled, it is not recommended to go to the rating tab in the PDA
List of models: Used to issue a random NPC model. The paths to the models are written from the "gamedata/meshes" folder. There is no need to read and edit the models themselves. To change the available NPC models, it is enough to change the list without copying the model files themselves anywhere
Voice acting list: It is used to issue random NPC voice acting. The paths to the voiceover are written from the "gamedata/sounds" folder. Similarly to models, the voice files themselves are not needed for the program to work, just edit the list (if the program is used on top of the mod with additional voice acting). Unlike the paths to the models, here you need to add a backslash to the end of the lines.
List of groupings: The names of the groupings can be taken from the file "game_relations.ltx" (not used in this program) or from the files "character_desc_*.xml"
List of thumbnails: "Photos" of NPCs shown during dialogues, viewing contacts or searching corpses
List of names: Actually, the names of the NPCs. Random names are generated when GENERATE_NAME_[something] is used Checkbox "Use only GENERATE_NAME" disables the use and replacement of special names (quest, etc.)
List of exceptions: Not all NPCs can have their properties changed. This list was created for such cases. In the original, for example, you can't touch the Barman and Sidorovich. The main character can be edited, but only the grouping can change there, which is not very convenient, because he is also excluded by default. To add NPCs to exceptions, use the "id" parameter of the "specific_character" tag in the "character_desc_*.xml" files located in ./rndata/gamedata/config/gameplay.
Checkboxes near the names of the lists allow you to enable/disable some items in the generation of NPCs

data.name: npcReplaceProbInput
data.value: The probability of generating for each NPC section

data.name: npcRulesError
data.value: Rules for generating NPCs have not been received. A call to "updateRules" is required

data.name: onePointFourAdvertise
data.value:
The guys from Metacognix write: "The 1.0006 game engine has code changes that cause crashes when weapons, ammo or other items are destroyed while they are still being used..." And "This error can also happen in mods that change ammo and/or weapons"
https://www.metacognix.com/stlkrsoc/CrashesStillInTheGame.html
The error itself looks like this:
sv reject.id_parent[21043][mil_freedom_respawn_3: mil_freedom_respawn_321043] id_entity[36660][bolt: bolt][137703] sv reject.id_parent[21043][mil_freedom_respawn_3: mil_freedom_respawn_321043] id_entity[21049][wpn_svu: wpn_svu21049][137703] sv reject.id_parent[21043][mil_freedom_respawn_3: mil_freedom_respawn_321043] id_entity[21048][kolbasa: kolbasa21048][137703] sv reject.id_parent[21043][mil_freedom_respawn_3: mil_freedom_respawn_321043] id_entity[21047][device_torch: device_torch21047][137703] sv reject.id_parent[21043][mil_freedom_respawn_3: mil_freedom_respawn_321043] id_entity[21046][bread: bread21046][137703] sv reject.id_parent[21043][mil_freedom_respawn_3: mil_freedom_respawn_321043] id_entity[21045][ammo_7.62x54_7h1: ammo_7.62x54_7h121045][137703] sv reject.id_parent[21043][mil_freedom_respawn_3: mil_freedom_respawn_321043] id_entity[21044][device_pda: device_pda21044][137703] sv ownership id_parent[21043][NOTFOUND] id_entity[23538][wpn_eagle_m1: wpn_eagle_m123538][137703]
FATAL ERROR
[error]Expression: assertion failed [error]Function: xrServer::Process_event_ownership [error]File: E:\stalker\sources\trunk\xr_3da\xrGame\xrServer_process_event_ownership.cpp [error]Line: 23 [error]Description: e_parent
stack trace: Scheduler tried to update object mil_freedom_respawn_321043
Since the error is at the engine level, I can't fix it (and in case of correction, this randomizer would be more difficult to run with mods). I tried to find in *.script files something related to the words "parent", "ownership", "assert". But everything I found eventually referred to native C++ code or performed other functions. But the question arises, is editing the numbers in the weapon files considered a sufficient change to cause this error? I suspect not. Most likely, the problem is related to the generation of NPCs. And there are several options here: 1. Generation of NPC weapons. NPCs, as a result of giving them random weapons, much more often begin to pick up weapons from the ground. And as a result of an unsuccessful selection of other weapons offline, the game crashes when the player approaches this unsuccessful NPC 2. Increase in the frequency of respawn of NPCs. More NPCs - more action with weapons. When there are too many NPCs, one of them decides to break everything 3. Expansion of the NPC's joining to the camps. This option also increases the respawn frequency (though not so much), which, coupled with the settlement of unsuitable NPCs in any camps, leads to.. To something there. As a result, someone's weapon loses its owner's id (lol) 4. All of the above
If anyone has any ideas on how to fix this, I'm open to suggestions
And so I recommend using the 1.0004 version of the game

data.name: onePointFourLink
data.value: The 1.0004 version of the game works with this randomizer more stable than 1.0006. But why?

data.name: probabilityDescription
data.value:
The lower the probability, the fewer changes there will be in the gameplay for each of the parameters.
With the set value of 100, everything will be generated/mixed.

data.name: rainProbability
data.value: The probability of rain for each weather class

data.name: soundsError
data.value: Sound processing error. The operation was aborted

data.name: soundsPath
data.value: The path to the sounds folder

data.name: soundsRoundStep
data.value: The rounding step of the duration of audio files in seconds (using large values at your own risk)

data.name: soundTexturesDescription
data.value:
To shuffle textures and sounds, you need to have unpacked gamedata.db* game files with textures and sounds. The paths to the data folders must be specified in the appropriate fields.
The shuffiling process can take a long time, especially if the game files are on the hard drive and not on the SSD. Also, copying mixed textures/sounds will require about 2GB of disk space (for the original game).
The maximum number of threads to process sets the number of simultaneously processed directories when reading data from texture/sound files.

data.value: In a nutshell: I do not know, but...

data.name: weaponEverywhere
data.value: The opportunity to get weapons in the bar, in the scientists' bunker and at Sidorovich's

data.name: weaponGuide
data.value:
List of weapons and cartridges used:
It is used to add weapons to caches, issue weapons to NPCs and to generate an assortment of merchants. The type of cartridges is necessary to add to the NPCs so that the people have ammunition to recharge.
List of cartridges and quantities in one pack: It is used to add cartridges to caches. The number of cartridges in a pack is necessary to eliminate the imbalance between the generations of different types of cartridges So, if you generate cleanly in the range from 1 to 100, you can get 80 RPG rockets and 3 9x18 cartridges Generation by bundles (1 for rocket, 20 for 9x18, etc.) fixes this problem.
It is necessary to separate cartridges with a quantity by a single space.
Lists of sounds of shooting and reloading - everything is clear
Lists from this tab are NOT used to generate weapon stats. Weapon stats are read and changed in their *.ltx files in the directory ./data/gamedata/config/weapons

data.name: weaponListTitle
data.value: Weapons and cartridges used by them

data.name: weaponReplaceProbInput

data.name: weatherHelp
data.value: A change in the weather mainly affects the color of the environment, therefore it may not be very pleasant. But the game will complement the RGB gaming keyboard and mouse well
